name: Ryan Lukson
statement:
**Elected Experience**  
Richland City Council 2018-Present  
Richland Mayor 2020-Present  
  
  
**Other Professional Experience**  
Benton County Prosecutor’s Office 2011-Present  
Currently Assistant Chief Civil Deputy Prosecutor  
  
  
**Education**  
University of Washington, Business-Finance 2004  
Florida State University College of Law 2009  
  
  
**Community Service**  
Community Service:  
Richland Police Pension Board  
Richland Fire Pension Board  
Tri-Cities National Park Committee  
Chair of Municipal Advisory Council COVID Response Committee  
TRIDEC Board  
Benton Franklin Council of Governments Board  
  
  
**Statement**  

It has been my pleasure to serve on the Richland City Council since 2018, and as your Mayor since 2020. Our city has faced unprecedented challenges in the last several years in response to the global pandemic. I am proud to have helped lead the effort advocating for our city and region to safely re-open our community as soon as possible.

We have achieved so much as a city the last four years, and our resiliency has never been more apparent. Richland is growing by leaps and bounds. As Mayor, I have been committed to reinvesting in our parks, roads, and public infrastructure. During my tenure on council we have completed construction of the Duportail Bridge, as well as a new city hall and fire stations. These investments will serve our community for generations to come.

Going forward, I am excited about the revitalization efforts we have undertaken through targeted downtown investments. I am committed to continuing to invest in our downtown and make it the jewel of our region.

I’m asking for your vote to continue the progress we have made as a city the last four years.
